intro: Trattinnickia dalyana, commonly known as the Daly's rockheath, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Trattinnickia dalyana is a low-growing shrub that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
